duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and implement a strategic plan for the public art program in collaboration with the Public Art Council.
Identify potential sites for public art installations and work with community stakeholders to determine appropriate locations.
Manage budgets for public art projects and secure funding from grants and other sources.
Select and commission artists for public art projects, oversee contracts, and coordinate installation and maintenance.
Serve as the communication hub for public art projects and build support for the program among community stakeholders.
Maintain and edit the public art website, coordinate art walks, and prepare reports on the progress of the public art program.
Collaborate with the executive director of the Newberg Downtown Coalition as appropriate.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Art Administration, Public Administration, or a similar field (Preferred)
